did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Bronis J. Kaslas papers, 1899-1974
did.abstract: The papers consist of writings and rare printed matter relating to Eastern European politics, the Russian occupation of Lithuania, Lithuanians in foreign countries, the Baltic States, Poland, and the Paris Peace Conference of 1946.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1976.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: A Lithuanian-American historian, Kaslas was the author of several books including The Lithuanian Strip in Soviet-German Secret Diplomacy, 1939-1941 and The USSR-German Aggression against Lithuania.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of writings and rare printed matter relating to Eastern European politics, the Russian occupation of Lithuania, Lithuanians in foreign countries, the Baltic States, Poland, and the Paris Peace Conference of 1946.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: World War, 1939-1945--Lithuania.
World War, 1939-1945--Peace.
